meanings.sent1: The strong lock on the door was precluding any intruders from entering.
meanings.sent2: The safety measures in place were precluding any accidents from occurring.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's superpowers were precluding any disasters in the city.
meanings.sent4: The thick fog precluding visibility on the road, making driving dangerous.
meanings.sent5: The umbrella precluding the rain from soaking her clothes.

meanings.sent1: The magician's trick was so precluding that no one could figure it out.
meanings.sent2: The complex puzzle was precluding any easy solutions.
meanings.sent3: The locked door was precluding any escape for the trapped cat.
meanings.sent4: The dense forest precluding any passage through it.
meanings.sent5: The high wall precluding any view of the beautiful garden.

meanings.sent1: His strict criteria were precluding many candidates from being selected.
meanings.sent2: The specific requirements were precluding certain options from being chosen.
meanings.sent3: The limited budget was precluding any extravagant purchases.
meanings.sent4: The rules were precluding any deviations from the original plan.
meanings.sent5: The terms of the contract were precluding any renegotiation.
